document.docTitle: Konowia kojimai Shinohara & Hara 2021, n. sp.
document.masterDocTitle: Konowia Brauns, 1884, and Monoxiphia, n. gen. (Hymenoptera, Xiphydriidae) Palaearctic woodwasps with simple tarsal claws on all legs

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Konowia Brauns, 1884, and Monoxiphia, n. gen. (Hymenoptera, Xiphydriidae) Palaearctic woodwasps with simple tarsal claws on all legs

mods:name.mods:affiliation: National Museum of Nature and Science, 4 - 1 - 1 Amakubo, Tsukuba, Ibaraki, 305 - 0005 Japan.

heading.emphasis:
Konowia kojimai Shinohara & Hara
, n. sp.

subSubSection.paragraph: ( Figs 1C, D, H , 2 G–L, 3C, F, G, J, 4K–O, 5B, E, 6B, E, 8A–C, 10A–C)

Description . Female ( holotype , Figs 1C , 3G, J , 4M , 6B , 8C ). Length without ovipositor about 10.0 mm. Head black. Mouth parts blackish brown to black; ligula mostly whitish and mandible dark brownish gray subapically. Antenna entirely black. Thorax black, outer margin of tegula dark brown. Legs black; tibiae apically and tarsi partly dark brownish. Wings weakly darkened, forewing more strongly darkened toward base; veins and stigma blackish brown. Abdomen black; last tergum and ovipositor sheath each with very narrow apex pale brown.

Male ( paratype from Shinonome-ko, Fig. 10 A–C). Length about 5.0 mm. Similar to female in color and structure except as follows: Apical half of mandible, antennal scape, pedicel and flagellomere 1 and tegula mostly, apex of each tibia, and each tarsus except at apex pale brown (as in Fig. 6E ). Both antennae with 13 antennomeres; flagellomere 2 about 3.4× longer than broad; hind tarsomere 1 about 1.1× length of tarsomeres 2–4 combined; abdominal tergum 9 flattened, without median longitudinal keel, broadly rounded at apex; sternum 9 with posterior margin roundly incised at middle. Genitalia as in Fig. 10 A–C; valviceps rather slender, apical projection comparatively long.

Variation ( Tables 1 , 2 ). Female: The length without ovipositor varies from 7.5 to 10.5 mm (n=3). The color pattern shows no conspicuous variations. The antenna has 13 or 14 antennomeres (n=5); flagellomere 2 about 2.7–3.1× longer than broad. The crossvein 2r-m in the forewing is interstitial with the crossvein 2m-cu on the vein M ( Figs 1C, D , 2G , 6B ). The crossvein 2r-m in the hindwing is present in two paratypes . The valvula 3 (apical sheath) is about 0.8–0.9× length of the valvifer 2 (basal sheath) (n=3) ( Fig. 8 A–C). Male: The length varies from 5.0 to 7.0 mm (n=5). The color pattern shows no conspicuous variations. The antenna has 13 (n=8) or 15 antennomeres (n=2); flagellomere 2 about 2.9–3.5× longer than broad. The crossvein 2r-m in the forewing is interstitial with the crossvein 2m-cu on the vein M. The crossvein 2r-m in the hindwing is present in one paratype and absent in three paratypes , and the crossvein 2r-m is present but atrophied in one paratype .

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology . This new species is named in honor of Mr. Haruyoshi Kojima, Nagano , who collected the holotype .

Remarks . This new species is characterized by the largely coarsely microsculptured vertex ( Fig. 3C, F, G, J ) and mesoscutellum (5B, E), the thin antenna ( Fig. 4 K–O), the comparatively short hind tarsomere 1, the interstitial crossveins 2r-m and 2m-cu on the vein M in the forewing ( Figs 1C, D , 2G , 6B ), and the comparatively short valvula 3 (apical sheath) (see the key for more details).
